oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The handsome child, who is ill, is not to be sent to fetch water. By /han=kasso (L VIII.-15. 7296-7298). When a 'good-looking' or handsome person is ill he is taken care of because of his appearance. 1) |han=kass'o heard this story from his mother (|xabbi-an), 2) Sorcerers 'seize' good-looking people, making them ill: see also Sorcerers are like lions, 3) This story is found in Book VIII-15.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: When a good-looking person is ill
